title: your favourite serif font?
content:
hey!

what's your favourite serif font?  
(especially for use on print stuff)

thanks!  
file
author: file

comments.content:
adobe garamond, it's sophisticated, easy to read and the letterforms are just beautiful :)

Niki

Hard to decide... I guess my favorites are:

• Bembo  
• Sabon  
• Plantin

cheerio Queneau

If i had to decide this today – Lexicon ( [http://www.teff.nl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.teff.nl/ "http://www.teff.nl/"))  
Tomorrow maybe Sabon, Stempel Garamond, Arnhem, Dolly, etc.

[Dante](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.monotypefonts.com/Library/HiddenGems.asp?show=dante)  
 [FF Quadraat](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_quadraat/)  
 [Greta Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.typotheque.com/fonts/greta_text/) (although I haven't yet used it myself)

great - some of them i haven't known before!  
some more favourites anyone? :)

I would have to say the new and amazing scotch from Hoefler & Frere-Jones called Chronicle. [http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100031](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100031 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100031")

I've finally saved up enough to buy it;-) Pheww

the last serif i licensed: [Feijoa](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/vllg.com/KLIM/Feijoa/mudTyper+Weights/)  
the next one i hope to: [Anselm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-86-anselm-serif-pro)

previous licenses:  
 [Relato](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/emtype.net/relato_1.html)  
 [Papaerback](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=171)

others on my wish list:  
 [Eason](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/eason.asp)

also, i'm quite pleased that Arno Pro came bundled with the latest CS upgrade.
I'm using Kris's Newzald for a couple of books at the moment... it sets nice. would like to grab Storms Baskerville Ten pro, good book face I reckon, Walbaum too.

Dolly is great. I have enjoyed using it.

Sharon

Minion used to be my "go-to" serif. Now it's [Whitman](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Whitman). On my wish list: [Elmhurst](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Elmhurst), [Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller), [Chronicle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100032), [Requiem](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090856/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100020), yada, yada, yada...
